title: Coat of arms of Adjara
text:
The <a href="coat%20of%20arms">coat of arms</a> of the <a href="Autonomous%20Republic%20of%20Adjara">Autonomous Republic of Adjara</a> is a <a href="escutcheon%20%28heraldry%29">shield</a> <a href="division%20of%20the%20field">divided</a> in two by a wavy <a href="line%20%28heraldry%29">line</a>. In the center is a <a href="Gules">red</a> <a href="inescutcheon">smaller shield</a> of the <a href="Coat%20of%20arms%20of%20Georgia%20%28country%29">Lesser Arms of Georgia</a>, <a href="charge%20%28heraldry%29">bearing</a> a <a href="argent">silver</a> horseman (<a href="St.%20George">St. George</a>) with a <a href="Or%20%28heraldry%29">golden</a> <a href="halo%20%28religious%20iconography%29">halo</a> mounted on a silver horse and slaying a silver <a href="Saint%20George%20and%20the%20Dragon">dragon</a> with a golden-tipped, silver-shafted spear. The upper sector of the main shield bears a golden fortress on a <a href="Vert%20%28heraldry%29">green</a> <a href="field%20%28heraldry%29">field</a> and the lower one contains three golden coins on <a href="Azure%20%28heraldry%29">blue</a> field. 
The coat of arms was adopted by the <a href="Supreme%20Council%20of%20Adjara">Supreme Council of Adjara</a> in 2008. Its use is regulated by the <a href="Constitution%20of%20the%20Autonomous%20Republic%20of%20Adjara">Constitution of Adjara</a> and the republic's special law.
